messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: BALTIMORE POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION DIVISION
Traffic Enforcement Unit
SIGNAL: 56T
ITEM NUMBER: T-56045-23
PAGE 16 of 55
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Emily Johnson
Sgt. Thomas White
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Richard Brooks
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Olivia Martinez
Sgt. Kevin Harris
( Road Safety Unit)
Det. Sarah Thompson
Det. Mark Gonzalez
( Road Safety Unit)
Det. Laura Wright
( Road Safety Unit)
Det. Andrew Young
Det. Patricia King
(General Assignment)
Det. Lisa Walker
(Vehicle Theft Unit)
Det. James Carter
(Hit and Run Investigation Unit)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, age 34, local cyclist.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
27 MAY 2023 at around 6:30 PM near Patterson Park.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Richard Brooks
4267
The case involved intricate traffic patterns and obscured surveillance footage. Officer Davis, patrolling near Patterson Park, was the first to notice the aftermath of the hit and run. He was joined by Sgt. Olivia Martinez and Patrol Officer Edwards, who quickly cordoned off the area. Technician Murphy, specializing in traffic incident reconstruction, was called in to piece together the events. Criminalist Fisher, examining the scene, discovered vehicle fragments that led to the identification of the suspect's car. Coroner Dr. Mitchell was brought in to examine the victim, revealing details essential to understanding the incident. Patrol Officer Bailey, liaising with local residents, uncovered eyewitness accounts that provided critical leads in the investigation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Emily Johnson Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Traffic Enforcement Unit. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Thomas White Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Johnson. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Richard Brooks Officer Context: Lead investigator of the traffic incident, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Olivia Martinez Officer Context: Assisted at the hit and run scene, part of the Road Safety Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Kevin Harris Officer Context: Road Safety Unit sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Sarah Thompson Officer Context: Road Safety Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Mark Gonzalez Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Road Safety Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Laura Wright Officer Context: Road Safety Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Andrew Young Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Patricia King Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the hit and run case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Lisa Walker Officer Context: Vehicle Theft Unit detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. James Carter Officer Context: Hit and Run Investigation Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Davis Officer Context: First to notice the aftermath of the hit and run near Patterson Park. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Edwards Officer Context: Assisted in cordoning off the hit and run scene. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Murphy Officer Context: Specialized in traffic incident reconstruction, worked on the case. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Fisher Officer Context: Examined the scene, found vehicle fragments linked to the suspect's car. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Mitchell Officer Context: Examined the victim, provided essential details for the case. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Bailey Officer Context: Gathered eyewitness accounts from local residents, aiding the investigation. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
